question: 危ない
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>dangerous</kanji>? It's <vocabulary>dangerous</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Someone is in danger! It's poor old <reading>abe</reading> (<ja>あぶ</ja>) Lincoln. You try to save him, yelling out <ja>危ないよ！！！！</ja>, but he gets shot in the back of the head anyways.
